text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#ff0000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: A lot of progress has been made on supporting the VO/Vulcan language. We expect that in the next few weeks you will be able to completely compile your Vulcan applications in X# (Vulcan dialect) with no or minimal changes.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#ff0000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The areas where you may find some incompatibilities at this moment is for the automatic conversion between USUAL type and other types.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#ff0000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Also the support for the VOSTRUCT and UNION types is not complete.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#ff0000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The Visual Studio integration supports the Edit/Compile/Debug cycle. The Form editor and WPF editor are also working now.

text.style: font-family:Calibri; font-size:11pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#ff0000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Please note that this is an early build of the compiler. Some things will NOT work; you can be sure of this.
